section.title: Creating the Component with a Page Tag
section.para: Here is a simple example as it could be used on a page:
section.programlisting: ... <rich:dataTable value="#{bean.model}" var="var" id="tb"> <rich:columns value="#{bean.columns}" var="col"> <h:outputText value="#{var.property1}" /> </rich:columns> </rich:dataTable> ...

section.title: Creating the Component Dynamically Using Java
Details of Usage
section.para: The <rich:columns> component gets a list from data model and outputs corresponding set of columns inside <rich:dataTable> on a page.
The <rich:columns> component allows to use "header" and "footer" facets.
The simple example is placed below
section.programlisting: ... <rich:dataTable value="#{bean.model}" var="var" id="tb"> <rich:columns value="#{colBean.columns}" var="col"> <f:facet name="header"> <h:outputText value="#{col.header}" /> </f:facet> <h:outputText value="#{row.value}"/> <f:facet name="footer"> <h:outputText value="#{col.footer}"/> </f:facet> </rich:columns> </rich:dataTable> ...
section.para: The <rich:columns> component does not prevent to use <rich:column>. In the following example one column renders in any way and another columns could be picked from the model:
section.programlisting: ... <rich:dataTable value="#{rowBean.rows}" var="row"> <rich:column> <h:outputText value ="#{row.columnValue}"/> </rich:column> <rich:columns value="#{colBean.columns}" var="col"> <f:facet name="header"> <h:outputText value="#{col.header}"/> </f:facet> <h:outputText value="#{row.columnValue}"/> <f:facet name="footer"> <h:outputText value="#{col.footer}"/> </f:facet> </rich:columns> </rich:dataTable> ...

section.title: Look-and-Feel Customization
section.para: For skinnability implementation, the components use a style class redefinition method. Default style classes are mapped on skin parameters.
There are two ways to redefine the appearance of all <rich:columns> components at once:

listitem.para: Add to your style sheets style classes used by a <rich:columns> component

section.title: Skin Parameters Redefinition
section.para: Skin parameters redefinition for <rich:columns> are the same as for the <rich:dataTable> component.

section.title: Definition of Custom Style Classes
section.para: Custom style classes for <rich:columns> are the same as for the <rich:dataTable> component.
In order to redefine styles for all <rich:columns> components on a page using CSS, it's enough to create classes with the same names and define necessary properties in them.
To change styles of particular <rich:columns> components, define your own style classes in the corresponding <rich:columns> attributes.
